title: 'Dirty Dancing' lake is filling up with water 12 years after it dried up
description: In 2008, Mountain Lake, made famous by the 1987 film "Dirty Dancing," dried up and remained that way for over a decade. But this summer, it's starting to fill back up, astonishing both locals and visitors.

title: Unusual supernova sent this star speeding across our galaxy
description: A white dwarf star has been sent zooming across our Milky Way galaxy thanks to the blast from a unique kind of supernova that it managed to survive, according to a new study.

title: US allies band together against China
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping surprised the world with a speech at Davos in 2017, defending free trade and joint action on climate change as then US president-elect Donald Trump argued for precisely the opposite. It might have been an overambitious pitch by Xi to position China as the world's next leader, but it also seemed a genuine sign that Beijing was committing to the international rules-based order.

title: World's population likely to shrink after 50 years
description: The world's population is likely to peak at 9.7 billion in 2064, and then decline to about 8.8 billion by the end of the century, as women get better access to education and contraception, a new study has found.

title: Nursing home recreates famous album covers using its residents as models
description: The residents of one nursing home in England have turned into album cover stars.

title: Trump leans into racist rhetoric and downplays police violence against Black Americans
description: President Donald Trump repeated racist talking points in downplaying police violence against Black Americans during a CBS News interview on Tuesday, claiming that "more White people" are dying at the hands of law enforcement than Black people.

title: China reels as 'grim' flooding disaster threatens coronavirus recovery
description: Weeks of torrential rains have caused the worst flooding in China in recent decades, destroying the homes and livelihoods of millions of people as the country struggles to revive an economy battered by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Trump admin. scraps policy that would have seen foreign students deported
Early trials for coronavirus vaccine show 'promising' results
description: A Covid-19 vaccine developed by the biotechnology company Moderna in partnership with the National Institutes of Health has been found to induce immune responses in all of the volunteers who received it in a Phase 1 study.

title: Coronavirus cases soar by more than 1 million over 5 days
Ivanka Trump campaign tells out-of-work Americans to 'find something new'
description: Four months before the presidential election, Ivanka Trump, adviser to her father President Donald Trump, is promoting a new ad campaign dubbed, "Find Something New."

title: Apple customers can now submit claims as part of settlement over slowing down iPhones
description: Apple customers who purchased certain previous iPhone models can now submit claims for about $25 per phone as part of the company's settlement of a class action lawsuit that accused it of slowing down older devices.

title: Lindsey Graham breaks with Trump in Fauci feud
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) spoke out in support of Dr. Fauci after President Trump publicly criticized the immunologist and an unnamed White House official tried to discredit him.

title: One man holds multiple trademarks on potential Washington Redskins replacement names
description: The Washington NFL franchise announced on Monday that it would be changing its team name, but one man has already beaten them to the punch by trademarking a number of potential options.

title: Bus driver deliberately crashes killing 21 people
description: Local Police say a driver deliberately crashed a bus full of passengers into a reservoir in southwestern China, hours after discovering his house had been demolished.

title: Viola Davis stars on a history-making new magazine cover
description: Vanity Fair's latest edition is fronted by Oscar-winning actor Viola Davis as photographed by Dario Calmese. It's the first time a Black photographer has shot the cover.

title: Trump repeatedly calls famous football coach by wrong name
description: President Donald Trump repeatedly referred to the University of Alabama's head football coach Nick Saban by the wrong name during a call on the eve of the state's Republican runoff race.

title: American woman caught in romance scam freed after being held by lover for more than a year
description: A man has been arrested for allegedly luring an American woman to Nigeria and defrauding her of $48,000, police told CNN on Tuesday.

title: UK will pay hefty price for kicking out Huawei
description:
• How much trouble is Huawei in?
• Here's why 5G is the future

title: US carries out first federal execution in 17 years
description: Daniel Lewis Lee, a convicted killer, was executed Tuesday morning. It was the first federal execution in 17 years after the Supreme Court issued an overnight ruling that it could proceed.

title: Doctors remove a worm that was living in woman's tonsil
description: A  woman in Japan got more than she bargained for after visiting the doctor with an irritated throat, as she was told that a worm was living inside her tonsil.

title: UK will pay a hefty price for kicking out Huawei
Radio host loses show after harassing Spanish-speaking workers
description: Dianna Ploss, who had a show on WSMN in New Hampshire, livestreamed the racist incident on Facebook.

title: US declares most of Beijing's South China Sea claims illegal
description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Monday announced a formal rejection of "most" of China's maritime claims in the South China Sea, the latest in the escalation between Washington and Beijing.

title: Airline matriarch given suspended jail sentence for abusing domestic staff
description: The matriarch of the Korean Air dynasty has been given a suspended jail sentence for assaulting her domestic staff, including physically hurting her chauffeur and throwing metal shears at her gardener.

title: China sanctions Lockheed Martin for Taiwan arms sales
description: China said on Tuesday it would place sanctions on Lockheed Martin for its involvement in arms sales to Taiwan, a move that could further escalate tensions between Beijing and Washington.

title: Environmentalist sneaks past guards and makes shocking find
description: Russian authorities claim to have contained the massive spill in Norilsk, but a whistleblower and an environmentalist tell CNN the damage is much worse than disclosed and poses a threat to the ecosystem of the Arctic Ocean. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen reports.

title: 600,000 people voted in Hong Kong. China says they may have broken the law
description: A primary election held by Hong Kong's democratic opposition may have been illegal under the new security law, China said Monday, in a statement that shows how far the goalposts have moved just two weeks after the sweeping legislation was imposed on the city.

title: America shuts down again -- choosing reality over Trump's false claims
description:
• Can Trump fire Dr. Fauci? Technically, no.
• Florida now has more cases than most countries in the world
• Analysis: Trump's single weirdest belief

title: America shuts down again -- choosing reality over Trump's false claims
A bus driver deliberately crashed and killed 21 people after his house was demolished
description: A driver deliberately crashed a bus full of passengers into a reservoir in southwestern China, hours after discovering his house had been demolished, local police said Monday.

title: Tucker Carlson ex-staffer will take 'long-planned' vacation after racist posts revealed
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: Did the Queen order the removal of this Australian Prime Minister in 1975?
description: Queen Elizabeth II was not forewarned of the 1975 removal of Australian Prime Minister Gough Whitlam by then Governor-General John Kerr, according to classified papers released Tuesday, which reveal new details about the country's biggest constitutional crisis.

title: 'Glee' actress 'mustered enough energy' to rescue her son 'but not enough to save herself,' authorities say
description:
• Friends and colleagues remember Rivera
• 'Glee' cast no stranger to tragic deaths

title: Engineers have created a new kind of brick
description: Although we're surrounded by millions of them every day, most of us don't think about bricks too often. For thousands of years, the humble clay-fired brick hasn't changed. The building blocks of modern suburban homes would be familiar to the city planners of ancient Babylon, the bricklayers of the Great Wall of China, or the builders of Moscow's Saint Basil's Cathedral.

title: Radio station cuts ties with host filmed yelling at landscapers for speaking Spanish
description: A New Hampshire radio station cut ties with a conservative host after she filmed herself verbally attacking landscapers who were speaking Spanish.

title: Here's where major cities stand on reopening schools
description: School districts across the country are being forced to reconsider their reopening plans and even reverse course for the upcoming school year, as coronavirus infection rates continue to spike and new hot spots emerge.

title: America lost months making new protective gear. Now it's running out.
description: Nearly four months after invoking a 1950s-era law in order to compel businesses to manufacture equipment for the fight against the coronavirus, the Trump administration has made only sparing use of its authorities, leaving front-line workers in dire need of supplies like masks, gowns and gloves amid the recent surge in cases.

title: Tom Bergeron not returning as host of 'Dancing with the Stars'
description: It's the end of an era on "Dancing with the Stars."

title: Venezuela's collapsing economy drove them away. The virus is sending them home.
description: Venezuela's collapsing economy drove them away. Now the coronavirus is sending them back home.

title: Firefighters battling blaze on US Navy ship
description: Federal and Navy firefighters on Monday were still fighting a ferocious fire aboard the USS Bonhomme Richard amphibious assault ship docked at Naval Base San Diego.

title: Two NBA players are in quarantine after breaking the campus bubble
description: Two NBA players are under quarantine after accidentally leaving the league's Orlando, Florida, campus, just weeks before the league will resume play.

title: Stunning pictures captured Comet Neowise soaring through the sky
description: A three-mile wide comet named "NEOWISE" has lit up the skies, wowing people across the globe.

title: Search begins for a potential mass grave from the Tulsa race massacre
description: The search for possible mass graves from the Tulsa race massacre began Monday, nearly a century after hundreds of Black people were brutally killed by White rioters who burned and looted their community.

title: Naya Rivera 'mustered enough energy' to rescue her son 'but not enough to save herself,' officials say
Mary Trump free to promote her book after judge lifts restraining order
description: Get ready to see Mary Trump on television.
